Summary: 2 black round/disc shaped objected spotted over Newbury each with a pink/red spotlight that moved about the crafts
Object Flight Path: Stationary,Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
divs: sighting detailsi was visiting my family for sunday lunch and was in the living room with my sister and niece when a pink\red light caught my attention out the window. at first i thought it may have been the light from the crane that is in that direction but when i noticed it moving i rushed outside into the back garden to take a closer look. i was suprised to see a black round\disc shaped craft that had what looked like a pink\red spotlight that moved about from top, bottom and either sides of the craft (which was about the size of a large helicopter). this i thought was highly strange. there was no sound coming from the craft and was at low altitude, lower that the helicopters normally fly in this area. at first it was heading north in my direction whilst moving its spotlight around. then it changed direction and began moving east at a steady speed. i began fiming after a few seconds as luckily i had a digital camera with a video function in my pocket. after about 30 seconds the craft turned the pink\red light off and i could clearly see the blackness of the craft. my heart was pounding in my chest at this point. it started to pick up speed and i lost sight of it behind the rooftops up the hill. this sighting lasted about 2-3 minutes. i ran inside to show my sister the footage then headed back outside and spotted another craft travelling the same path (in a northely direction) 5-10 minutes after the first one i saw. this one had the same behaviour as the first and i decided to use the flash on my camera to try and get their attention. (they were low down underneath cloud cover) after the first flash from my camera they dimmed the pink\red light down, then after the second flash they turned the light off completely and the black object seemed to increase in size, (maybe lowering altitude?) it hovered stationary for no more than 5 seconds, then began heading south in the oposite direction. i ran after it but lost sight of it after i went inside to grab my coat. a truelly memorable evening! i have footage of both crafts although the first one was the only one that turned out visible when i watched them back on the computer.
